components.content:
You'll need to upload the following documents before you start your application:

  • your UK passport
  • your long UK birth certificate

You can either scan your documents or take photos on your mobile phone.

You may find it easier to take photos on your phone then send them to the device you are using for your application.

components.title: How to take a good photograph
components.content:
• Lay it flat on a table or for better results against a wall.
  • Make sure your address is readable.
  • No flash if possible.
  • Position the phone parallel to the document.
  • Use both hands to keep your phone steady.

We welcome your views on the registration service.

If you agree to be contacted by answering "yes" below, you will be consenting to share your personal data - name, email address, telephone number and service received - with our independent partner research agency, IFF research.

You may withdraw your consent at any stage by email Consular.research@fco.gov.uk.

For more details on how your data will be handled in relation to feedback please see the research privacy policy at www.gov.uk/fco/tell-fco.

components.name: PreferContacted

components.content: If you’re a British national getting a marriage or civil partnership abroad, you might need certain documents from the UK government, for example a certificate of no impediment (CNI).
Use this tool to find out how to get the documents you’ll need.
You’ll need to contact the local authorities where you want to get married to find out what you need to do.
Your marriage or civil partnership will be recognised in the UK if both of the following apply:

• you followed the correct process in the country where you got married
  • it would be allowed under UK law
There’s a separate guide if you want to get married or enter into a civil partnership in the UK.

components.content:
You'll need to upload the following documents before you start your application:

  • your UK passport
  • your long UK birth certificate

If you've been married or in a civil partnership before you'll also need to upload one of the following:

  • divorce decree absolute
  • final order
  • death certificate of your late partner
  • certificate of nullity

You can either scan your documents or take photos on your mobile phone.

You may find it easier to take photos on your phone then send them to the device you are using for your application.

components.title: How to take a photograph
components.content:
• Lay it flat on a table or for better results against a wall.
  • Make sure your address is readable.
  • No flash if possible.
  • Position the phone parallel to the document.
  • Use both hands to keep your phone steady.

pages.title: Entering into a civil partnership (PACS in France)

components.content: To enter into a civil partnership (PACS) in France you need to get a:

• official explanatory note
  • certificate of custom/ law for civil partnership
You'll need to give your certificate of custom and official notes to the town hall or court at least 6 weeks before your civil partnership.
You, your partner, or one of your parents need to have lived in the town where you want to get married for at least 40 days before the ceremony.

Official explanatory note

The town hall or court might ask you for a certificate of celibacy to prove you’re legally allowed to enter into a civil partnership.

British nationals can’t get this, so you’ll need to download this official explanatory note instead.

The official note is written in French. You don't need to add or change any of the words in the document, just print exactly as is.
Apply for a certificate of custom/ law for civil partnership

Apply for a certificate of custom online or download and complete a paper application.

A certificate of custom costs £50. You should receive your certificate within 3 weeks of applying.

! Warning You need to check if the name on your passport is the same as the name on your birth certificate. If the names are different, you'll need to provide documents that show how your name has changed.
Some town halls or courts only accept a certificate of custom dated less than 6 months before your civil partnership (PACS).

pages.title: How to get your certificate of custom/ law for civil partnership
